com.bitwise.decaf.editor.grammar
Class EnforcementOfficer

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.bitwise.decaf.editor.grammar.Officer
        |
        +--com.bitwise.decaf.editor.grammar.EnforcementOfficer
All Implemented Interfaces:
CodeNode.Listener, Decaf, Serializable, Utils.Renderable
Direct Known Subclasses:
TypeOfficer
public abstract class EnforcementOfficer
extends Officer
implements Utils.Renderable, CodeNode.Listener

Realtime code validation is performed by subclasses of the EnforcementOfficer class, each of which patrols a single Grammar instance for compliance with a particular rule or set of rules (typically from the JLS. An EnforcementOfficer maintains a boolean violation status, which, when true, is accompanied by a String description of the violation. When called, subclasses are expected to call back to this class with either violation(String) or noViolation(), thereby establishing the appropriate current status. EnforcementOfficer reports its changes in status to its chief, which by convention is a member of the Grammar it patrols.

See Also:
Officer.call(), Serialized Form

Field Detail

blues

public static Utils.List blues
A collection of the EnforecementOfficers who currently are declaring a state of violation. The associated Grammars have been turned blue (by Grammar.render()), and hence this list comprises the model for the BluesReview.

Constructor Detail

EnforcementOfficer

public EnforcementOfficer()
Abstract constructor; initially declares a state of no violation, as it is not patrolling anything.

public boolean report()
Returns:

explainViolation

public EnforcementOfficer.ViolationWindow explainViolation()
Obtain a window containing and explanation of the violation currently being declared by this officer. Behavior is undefined if this officer is not currently declaring a violation.

render

public JComponent render()
Obtain a displayable text representation of the path from the method body to the Grammar that this officer patrols.
